page.title: 18ST FITTICK'S CHURCH
page.content: The remains of St Fittick's Church lie due west off St Fitticks Road.The four walls of the church are still standing but it has succumbed to the elements since falling into disuse in the early 19th Century.Positioned in the north- wall is the window specially built to allow the lepers from the local colony to watch the service without being seen or coming into contact with the congregation.In the graveyard, which has been badly vandalised, are austere tablets to those who lost their lives at sea and also the more extravagent gravestones to those who survived and made their fortune especially as wine or cloth merchants. The oldest parts of the ruin are thought to have been built in 1242 by David de Bernham,Bishop of St Andrews, in honour of St Fittick who was washed ashore at Nigg Bay in the 7th century.
